items.sentence: Tom knew Mary had told everyone that she was going to do that.
Tom knew that Mary had told everyone she was going to do that.
Tom saw three guys standing in front of the convenience store.
Tom acknowledged that it was Mary who had organized the party.
You're the only person I know that has ever visited Australia.
If you could live anywhere in the world, where would you live?
I'm looking forward to meeting you all after such a long time.
Please don't open the train doors until the train has stopped.
I wasn't able to get Tom to understand what needed to be done.
Tom wasn't here last night. He was here the night before last.
We're closed every Monday and the third Sunday of every month.
I would've asked Tom to do that if I'd thought he could do it.
If it hadn't been for the map, we wouldn't have found the way.
You're more aware of what you want than what you already have.
I spent all my money on this, so I couldn't buy anything else.
While I understand what you're saying, I don't agree with you.
Tom prefers coffee and chocolate with a slightly bitter taste.
Tom wasn't the first one to encourage me to apply for the job.
I've never seen so many cars involved in one traffic accident.
Did you know that Tom and Mary have both spent time in prison?
